docs.title: PySoundSphere
docs.text: PySoundSphere is a high level audio playback library written in python.

docs.title: Play Audio
docs.text:
SounddevicePygame Play audio using sounddevice
from src.main import AudioPlayer

player = AudioPlayer("path/to/your/audio_file", "sounddevice")
player.play()
Play audio using pygame
from src.main import AudioPlayer

player = AudioPlayer("path/to/your/audio_file", "pygame")
player.play()

docs.title: Pause Audio
docs.text:
All Pause audio playback
from src.main import AudioPlayer
...
player.pause()

docs.title: Resume / Unpause Audio
docs.text:
All Resume audio playback
from src.main import AudioPlayer
...
player.play()

docs.title: Stop Audio
docs.text:
All Stop audio playback
from src.main import AudioPlayer
...
player.stop()

docs.title: Position
docs.text:
GetSet Get current position in audio
from src.main import AudioPlayer
...
current_position = player.position
print(current_position)
Set current position in audio
from src.main import AudioPlayer
...
new_position = 60
player.position = new_position

docs.title: Volume
docs.text:
GetSet Get current volume
from src.main import AudioPlayer
...
current_volume = player.volume
print(current_volume)
Set current volume
from src.main import AudioPlayer
...
new_volume = 0.25
player.volume = new_volume

docs.title: What are playback backends?
docs.text: Playback backends determine which libraries will be used to actually play the sounds. PySoundSphere currently supports sounddevice and pygame, with plans to later add support for PyAudio and ffplay. Each backend has different requirements.

docs.title: Which one should I use?
docs.text: This depends on your specific use case. If you are already using any of the required libraries, it will probably be best to go with that backend. For example, if your application already uses pygame, you should go with the pygame backend.

docs.title: Pygame
docs.text:
The pygame backend only needs pygame in order to run. Run the following command to install it.

Install requirements for pygame backend
pip install pygame

After that you can set up your backend like in the following.

Setup pygame backend
from src.main import AudioPlayer
player = AudioPlayer("path/to/your/audio_file", "pygame")

docs.title: Sounddevice
docs.text:
The sounddevice backend needs sounddevice, soundfile and numpy in order to run. Run the following command to install these.

Install requirements for sounddevice backend
pip install sounddevice soundfile numpy

After that you can set up your backend like in the following.

Setup sounddevice backend
from src.main import AudioPlayer
player = AudioPlayer("path/to/your/audio_file", "sounddevice")
